This is a game that I wanted to play for a while after knowing about it last year, so I got it and didn't regret it, I will agree with most people about that this game is great, a huge and fun arsenal of weapons at your disposal, the difficulty, pacing and environments, everything in this game is so good, it even has good graphics for its time. I highly recommend it.
The controls are a bit clunky and therefore all the precise jumping is quite annoying. I would only recommend this game if you would like to see a part of gaming history.

Half-Life ist zurecht ein Klassiker (habs jetzt glaub ich zur hälfte durch). Für mich als Shooter Noob :P echt ein Hammer Spiel.
Die einzigen Sachen die ich kritisieren würde sind die Sprungpassagen ( bin oft daran krepiert) und die blöden Leitern 
(die schlimmsten Gegner im Spiel XD ). Ansonsten kann ich ihn nur wärmstens empfehlen wer diesen wirklich sehr guten Shooter noch nie gespielt oder erlebt hat.

Kleiner Nachtrag: Habs mittlerweile durch und muss sagen echt geil gemacht aber der Endboss
muss ich leider sagen ist richtig Kacke und das Ende ist auch nur ziemlich Meh.

A certified classic. I played this game for the first time last year, and let me say that no game this old has pulled me into its world so well as Half-Life. Not only did I finish it (which rarely happens for me with retro titles) but I replayed it again just to see if I missed anything (which I did). Its graphics may be dated but its gameplay is timeless. The story telling was, and still is as engrossing and exciting as it was 20 years ago. If you're on the fence about picking it up trust me when I say no steam library is complete without it.

Valve's debut title stills hold up today as challenging, fun, unique, and a stunning-for-the-time example of telling a story in a shooter. I still enjoy going back and playing this game to relive all the real fun and exciting parts of the game, (getting the HEV Suit, launching the rocket/satellite, slaying the Nihilanth) and there is even more fun to be had in the online deathmatch. I have spent hours playing Crossfire and getting my butt kicked, but still having fun. Half-Life is one of those games that will never be forgotten due to how well it aged.

Best single-player FPS that i ever played to date.

I'd consider this game pretty close to being a masterpiece. The plot is pretty creative, the alien designs are brilliant, the game is hard without ever feeling like an absolute chore to blast through, the voice acting is pretty good for the time period. 

From what I've heard, most people don't like Xen, but personally it's my favorite part of the game. The platforming is rather odd, but the design of Xen, the crazy aliens, the Nihilanth speaking to you throughout your journey, just to be the freakiest fetus looking thing you've ever laid eyes on... it's seriously awesome.

Even though I liked Half Life 2, and things like the gravity gun, fast headcrab zombies, and awesome sound effects can't be forgotten, I think this one is just a bit better.

The golden standard of games, of which all FPS games should be compared to. 
The weapon arsenal, the AI and scripting still holds up and beats games to this day. That together with a mysterious story in the background while you're trying to find a way out through the steel corridors makes this the best game of all time, only competing with its sequel, Half-Life 2.

Одна из легендарных игр в индустрии! Игра повествование в которой идёт без кат сцен и не отбирая управление у игрока. В роли физика-теоретика Гордона Фримена предстоит выбраться из научно-исследовательского центра "Чёрная Меза". Препятствовать нам будут разнообразные враги, преодолевать которых нам поможет разнообразный арсенал в котором встречаются довольно необычные экземпляры оружия. ИИ врагов довольно хорош, солдаты используют укрытия, кидаются гранатами и ведут огонь на подавление. Монстры в свою очередь ведут себя соответствующе своему виду, зомби идут медленно на пролом, мелкие твари полагаются на скорость и т.д.. Локации достаточно интересные, а мир Зен очень необычен. Игра оставила много положительных эмоций, и несмотря на прошедшие годы, играется с таким же удовольствием. Крайне рекомендую!
such a nostalgia, I finished this game 5 times already XD

Es bonito volver atrás y ver de donde vienes. Este juego se comió una gran parte de mi infancia y, sinceramente, si eres alguien muy joven que jamás lo ha probado, no sé como reaccionarás, por lo menos a esta versión, existe una mejorada (Half Life Source), pero a mi nunca me mereció la pena, e incluso ahora hay una especie de remake (Black Mesa), un juego mucho más moderno y acorde a estos tiempos, sin abandonar el tan querido como odiado motor Source. Dicho esto.
Ojalá si eres alguien joven disfrutes de esta versión de Half life; con su misterio, con todo su microverso entorno a una jugabilidad única de valve. Si no te gusta siempre puedes probar la versión más moderna y esa quizá sí te enganche !

I recommend this game to anyone who can get it. It can run on any computer from a Dell laptop from 2008 and above with absolutely no issues. It is really fun, and the story is amazing. 10/10

[h1]TLDR:[/h1]
[b]Not the best thing since sliced bread, and honestly, not even close, but a very enjoyable experience with tense combat and some good visuals for 1998. Holds up quite well, aside from the ending parts of the game. It's quite long, too. Circa 8 - 10 hours long. I'd recommend this to any shooter fan. [u]I would recommend it at full price, and I strongly recommend it when it goes on sale, which, it goes on sale often[/u][/b] 

[h1]THE REAL REVIEW:[/h1]
Half-Life is a puzzle shooter from 1998 developed by Valve. It evolved gaming as a whole with its gameplay, visuals, and how the story is told to you in a first person perspective without control ever being taken away from you. 

[b][u]GAMEPLAY:[/u][/b]
Very tense and fun, though, it's a slog in the last 15% (Or so) of the game. Guns feel meaty, and there's a large variety of them, and enemies are fun to fight (With an exception of a boss) with a large variety of them as well. It's fights are a mixture of strategy and running and gunning (Hence the tag on the box, "Run, Think, Shoot, Live"). However, the hitscan from enemy soldier can get annoying at times because they do not telegraph their attacks. But aside from that, the opposing AI make competent foes and fun battles. Encounters never feel the same, making each battle in a separate playthrough fresh and interesting.

[b][u]STORY:[/u][/b]
The story itself is average with some average writing, but how it is told to you is done excellently. The game makes sure to keep you immersed in its world by never taking control from the player, and never taking the camera away from the 1st person perspective. It makes the  story more interesting than it actually is, and it's done very well. With the story, the voice acting is above par. The performances are awkward here and there, but aside from the occasional, goofy, scientist scream, the voice acting is decent.

[b][u]VISUALS:[/u][/b]
Good for the most part. However, art style is bland and ugly. I can see where they were going with it, but it's executed poorly. Other environments look quite nice for 1998, like [spoiler]Xen[/spoiler] and some outdoor environments here and there. Some textures are randomized, and that's quite impressive, even by today's standards. There's some nice flares on lights and some other details here and there that makes the experience feel lively.

[b][u]OTHER:[/U][/B]
Not really much else to say. I like the blood effects and how the alien blood is different from the human blood. I like gib effects. Seriously, not much else to say. The sound quality is quite low, even for 1998 standards, but that's a minor nit pick, really. Not much else. Doesn't affect the gameplay in any sort of way whatsoever.

[h1]OVERALL SCORE AND OPINION:[/h1]
[b]8.5/10[/b]

[i]The last part of the game in Xen is very boring. It's not fun, seriously. It was a slog playing through Xen. The moment it started, I wanted it to end. Combat was tedious and overall, not fun. It's good it only lasts at least 30 minutes to an hour. But even then, the fact that I have to play through Xen is irritating. As much as I recommend this game, I recommend you skip Xen and just look at the end cutscene on Youtube. It's extremely boring and tedious, despite looking nice for 1998.[/i]

Artı Yönleri
+Oyun yılına göre ilk öncelikle muhteşem
+Grafikleri yılına göre şahaser
+Silah çeşitliliği gayet iyi ve hikayesi de çok güzel (yılına göre)
+Oyunu 5-6 saate bitirebilirsiniz.Hiç bir bölümünden sıkılmıyorsunuz tam tersi yeni bosslar yeni silahlar geldikçe bağımlısı oluyorsunuz
+Bölümlerde boş yere uzatma yok.Yani silah deposu için fazla düşmanlar önünüze koymuyor
+Oyunda az bulmaca var.Her bulmaca da gayet güzel ve çözmesi keyifli
+Can ve Armor yerleri tam canınız azaldığınızda önünüze çıkıyor (bende nedense öyle :D )
+Oyunun yapay zekası yılına göre muhteşem

Eksi Yönleri 
-Füzeyi atınca hareketinizle ona yön vermeniz biraz zor.Benim gibi acemiyseniz tanklarla başınız biraz belada olabilir
-Havaya fırlatan şeylerde bazen az fırlatıyor bazen de fırlatmıyor ordan çıkınca bir anda fırlatıyor
-Bilim adamları sizi takip ederken uzaklaşınca duruyorlar.Onların hızıyla gitmeniz gerek bu da bilim adamlarından nefret etmemizi sağlıyor.
-Gördüğünüz askerler ya da polisler kapıyı açmak dışında bir halta yaramıyorlar kafasına sıkıp öldürün mermi alırsınız en azından

Not : Eksi yönlerinde dediğim şeyler sene 2019 olduğu içindir.Yoksa yılına göre eleştirsem efsane efsane efsane...

Hikaye : 8/10

10/10

The pinnacle of the 90's fps. Half-Life changed an industry and it's effects are still felt throughout gaming today. Half-Life created a seamless narrative that never left the character's point of view. There aren't any cutscenes or levels just a handcrafted linear experience. It's a great example of show don't tell as you uncover the story organically and put the pieces together to uncover the full picture. If you are looking for a game dripping with atmosphere and has great combat to boot, then Half-Life is the perfect fit for you. It is shockingly addictive and once you start you won't want to put it down.

I FUCKING HATE THIS GAME AND THIS REVIEWS IS UNIRONIC

THE LEVEL DESIGN IS 90% JUST QUICKSAVE AND THEN INSTANTLY AFTER

Half Life cumplió 2 décadas el año pasado (19 de noviembre de 2018), algo que personalmente me emocionó muchísimo y que me trajo muuuucha nostalgia, por ser fan de esta gran saga; habiendo pasado tanto tiempo creo que no hay mucho para agregar o decir a estas alturas... Este maravilloso juego (junto con otros clásicos como por ejemplo Quake) significó una revolución en el mundo de los FPS ("First Person Shooter"), ya que se convirtió en el paradigma o base que siguieron otros juegos del mismo género (tener en cuenta que gracias a HL apareció Counter Strike, otra joya). Incluso podemos decir claramente que Valve se convirtió en el coloso que es al día de hoy, gracias a estas 2 obras de arte (me refiero tanto a HL como a CS). Respecto al juego en sí, puedo decir que tiene una gran jugabilidad, donde hay acción toda la hora, constantemente tendremos que luchar y abrirnos paso por las diferentes secciones de Black Mesa; la historia es muy entretenida e interesante, amén de que siempre me agradó el protagonista, Gordon Freeman, se nota que los desarrolladores tuvieron buen tacto al elegir ese perfil de individuo como personaje principal; a mi parecer, tiene una de las mejores Soundtracks del mundo, ya que la música acompaña y ambienta perfectamente cada escenario (muy pocos juegos logran eso); gráficamente, está muy bien también, obviamente hoy en día se lo ve muy viejo comparado con los juegos que hay en la actualidad, hay que tener en cuenta la época (años 90'), donde el motor gráfico GoldSrc fue toda una innovación en aquellos tiempos. aún a pesar de ello, siempre me agradó mucho ese motor gráfico, no me importa que sea viejo la verdad. La única crítica que siempre hago es que es una verdadera lástima que nunca se hayan tomado la molestia de darle un final decente a esta gran saga, a esta gran historia, pero bueno... por todos los acontecimientos que sucedieron y que son de público conocimiento está más que claro que nunca veremos un "Half Life 3", por lo menos no de manera oficial. Mi calificación para esta Joya: 10/10.
Definitely worth a buy!
